dialogues.text: We confirm, this is our view as well. Over. Just then: A RUSH OF MONKEYS APPEARS, CHARGING AT ROY. HE PULLS HIMSELF BACK, through an AIRLOCK, YANKING the SMALL BLACK DATA BOX as well as BLUNT inside. Just in time, too as the MONKEYS SLAM into the AIRLOCK DOOR. Insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy pulls out a HELMET from a ROW of them, inside the airlock. Locking it into place on Blunt, placing carefull it over Blunt’s BLOODIED FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy and his cord--pulling the black box as well as an inanimate Blunt--move back to the Cepheus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roy approaches, the Cepheus is SPINNING. He gets to th surface of the craft, waits until the AIRLOCK DOOR approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlock doors whoosh open, and Roy rockets in with th  56. equipment and Blunt’s body on a tether cord. The doors cl behind him. He takes off his helmet. Yoshida helps him/th through the airlock; PULLING OFF BLUNT’S HELMET, he’s horrified to see what’s become of his Commander. Yoshida begins immediately to work on Blunt. Roy is out of breath

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: (to Roy) What the hell happened in there?!?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: It was a scientific vessel--they lost control somehow. (with gritted teeth) I tried to tell the Captain... ALL of you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: Tell us what?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: That we have a task in front of us. And that to stop would be a waste of fucking time. Yoshida goes back to work on the unresponsive Blunt. Lean his HEAD IN through the corrugated arch, ALAN TANNER reac for the BLACK BOX. He pulls it toward him. Then, sotto:

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: (re: Blunt) What’s his status? Yoshida SIMPLY SHAKES HIS HEAD. The CAPTAIN WON’T MAKE IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALAN TANNER (CONT’D) I’1l inform Don, he’ll have to be certified for flight. As Tanner PULLS the black box, Roy follows him into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner begins to draw on the BLACK BOX data. Scobee is go through his checklist, comparing it the BLACK BOX DATA th is coming in on the computer. Roy moves closer. The RADIO INTERRRUPTS:

dialogues.speaker: SPACECOM VOICE
dialogues.text: Cepheus, we received your message concerning Captain Blunt. We have Cpt. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SPACECOM VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Scobee’s retinal scan on file, and he is now in control of the craft. Over.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: This is Cpt. Scobee, SpaceCom. Roger that. Over. Sotto, to Scobee, Roy grabs Scobee’s arm:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Mars is our assigned destination. That is what requires our complete focus.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: Understood, Major. We’re on our way to Helios Station. (louder; to Tanner) Prepare boosters D-6, D-9.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: Boosters D-6 and D-9, roger that. Roy HEARS something. Turns back to SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The life is leaving Blunt. ROY can SEE the BODY, ENTOMBED inside his SPACESUIT. Yoshida finishes reading LAST RITES

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: .+-I commend you to almighty God, and entrust you to your Creator. May the angels and the saints come to meet you, as you go forth from this life. May you see your Redeemer face to face and enjoy the vision of God for ever... (to the men) Airlock engaged.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: Airlock engaged, roger that. The AIRLOCK opens. A WHOOOSH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CEPHEUS RELEASES BLUNT’S BODY into the VOID...  58. Their fallen commander tumbles away, into the darkness. T Cepheus’ BOOSTER ROCKETS FIRE, and the CRAFT speeds away- leaving Blunt’s body to tumble. Forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RED PLANET, floating in space. A space elevator with SPINNING DOCKING STATION is tethered to the planet. The Cepheus ARRIVES into view, its retros thrusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men speak:

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: (to radio) SpaceCom, we are approaching Mars, Helios North. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slows to a stop as it DOCKS with THE DOCKING BAY conne to MARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roy, Tanner, Scobee, and Yoshida ready themselves to leave: A DOWNLOAD COMMENCES.

dialogues.speaker: SPACECOM VOICE
dialogues.text: Cepheus, this is SpaceCom. We have a secure download for passenger Roy McBride.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: Send it through. Over. The FILE DOWNLOADS. Roy takes the chip and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy downloads the chip:  59.

dialogues.speaker: SPACECOM VOICE
dialogues.text: An additional message was sent to the moon’s communications center, approximately seven hours after your departure. ROY FOCUSES. On a SCREEN comes: THE IMAGES OF THE MEDIEVA CASTLE THAT ROY has OBSESSED OVER! The MUSIC is odd, a strange “easy listening” tune... ROY MOVES CLOSE TO THE SCREEN. Then, the IMAGERY CUTS OUT leaving a TEXT SENTENCE, white TEXT on BLACK SCREEN: “BRE YOU COMING?” NEW LINE of TEXT: “06:10:00” ANGLE ON ROY as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy SHAKES the hands of Scobee and Yoshida and Tanner:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: My condolences for Captain Blunt, gentlemen. I do appreciate the ride and wish you the best on the rest of your journeys.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Major. Glad we could be of service... The HATCH OPENS for ROY, and he glides through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy is in the shuttle to Helios South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the docking bay of the space station. Nobody's here to greet him, although there are cameras and active screens. BEEEEP! ROY SPEAKS:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: McBride, Roy C. Submit.  60. Steps forward and puts his eye in the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON A SCREEN
dialogues.text: Approved. A moment, then a WHOOSH! A LARGE DOOR OPENS TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW, entering in the elevator. Roy looks out, SEEING THE RED PLANET’S SURFACE APPROACHING as the thing descend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR “lands” on MARS. The LARGE STEEL DOOR UNLOCK AUTOMATICALLY. ROY steps out. We don’t see any people here yet. But several SIBERIAN HUSKIES walk up and down the halls of the installation. A couple of them come up to our men and sniff around. A weird SCREECHING sound pervades--as if something large inside the station needs repair...or, at the very least, WD40. THEN: A FEW SCIENTISTS staggering down the hall, too--SIN some unknown song badly, somewhat drunkenly. A GUY IN ROL SKATES speeds past in the background. A SEEMINGLY INSANE MARS OFFICER, a woman of fifty, charge Roy:

dialogues.speaker: MARS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Did you bring us seeds?!? What about canned produce, did you do

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: No. I’m sorry. I don’t have any. Sorry... Is your commanding officer-- Roy looks past her. It’s MADNESS. More passersby, more revelry... and the return of the Roller-Skater. Next comes an unctuous officer named SERGEANT PETER BELLO (fiftysomething, strangely tan) greets our man. He may no be drunk, but it’s unclear if he has his wits about him.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO
dialogues.text: (with a slightly mad grin, too loud at times) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good afternoon! Or evening--or whatever the fuck! WELCOME TO THE

dialogues.speaker: VERY LAST MANNED OUTPOST IN OUR
dialogues.text: SOLAR SYSTEM! [I'm] Sergeant Bello... You comin’ from earth, or the moon??? OR WHAT?!? Wait, whose retinal scan’d I approve?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I’ve been sent by SpaceCom to conduct an inspection near Vallis Marineris and I need access to the location as soon as possible. I need to see a Colonel Lipset.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO
dialogues.text: Oh, I bet he’s at Shunga Show, brother! Where we should be! Keep ourselves right in the head--and down BELOW, if you get my meaning-- ROY INTERRUPTS him.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I need to talk to him. It’s urgent.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO
dialogues.text: Okay, cowboy... Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous dark space, almost like the Whale Room in New York's American Museum of Natural History. It’s lit only black light. PROJECTED ALL OVER, we SEE...several physically perfect STRIPPERS (holographic--but also totally lifelike). ROY joins the throng of SCIENTISTS & MILITARY. EVERYONE i SMOKING POT and doing a lot of other stuff. Roy walks through some of the strippers.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO
dialogues.text: (excitedly) They keep us company! Don’t misunderstand me, we’re not allowed’t make ‘em sentient, course. But our scientists here’ve tampered with ‘em--given ‘ema little more personality, we'll say! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BELLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're still well within legal A.I. cognition limits, I promise you! Roy looks around him at a couple of gorgeous (fake) women GYRATING IN UNISON to “TALKIN’ LOUD AND SAYIN’ NOTHING”. Roy SEES a LARGE BUFFET TABLE with PROCESSED FOOD. The virtual HOLO WOMEN move around Roy like ghosts. It’s James Brown night, evidently. The Godfather of Soul actually here in person, “on stage”--a perfect, life-like hologram. Roy's sort of pushing the Holo Women away, like swatting flies. His hand just goes through them. Roy and the rest the crew encounter: Sitting on a cushion, smoking a BONG and working on God-k what with old-fashioned pencil and paper, is astrophysici SAMIR MALIK--bearded, thirtysomething, bespectacled, hippyish. A shit-eating grin. HIS WIFE, CHERYL, is next t him. Projected around them is a WARM SPACE, almost like a high-end LOG CABIN. STANDING NEARBY: COLONEL LIPSET, a grizzled man, about forty-five years old. Lined face, gau He STARES AT ROY... SGT. BELLO (CONT’D) Sam, this guy’s got orders, from SpaceCom. Looking for a Colonel Lipset. Malik smiles broadly, holds out a hand to shake Roy’s. COMPLETELY STONED. His hand is robotic, a metallic gold ( no explained reason).

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Samir Malik--I’m superintendant. With National Institute of Sciences. Cal-Tech Mafia! This’s my wife, Cheryl.

dialogues.speaker: CHERYL
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: (with a snort) Well, it’s a pleasure to meet anybody this far out--’specially anybody with their heads screwed on straight! END of the LINE here!  63. Awkward pause, the MEN LOOK AROUND at the surroundings. COLONEL LIPSET is still staring. Then: SAMIR MALIK (CONT’D) (lets out a laugh) Gotta maintain that human connection somehow... The OFFICER REACHES DOWN to a METAL PLANK below his feet FLIPS a SWITCH. OFF GOES the HOLOGRAPHIC ROOM AROUND THEM that “HIGH-END LOG CABIN”, revealing the real space aroun them. Stepping forward is Colonel Lipset:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Major, I’m Colonel Lipset.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Sir. YES. As COLONEL LIPSET MOVES to shake Roy’s hand, he LEANS IN, softly into Roy’s EAR:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: I’ve been fully briefed. Straightening up, and louder:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Yessir. Roy turns, HANDS LIPSET A PRINTOUT. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) My destination is these coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: (looks, then to Malik) Dr. Malik? MALIK LOOKS AT IT, then UP AT THEM, LIKE ROY’S NUTS. Grow DEADLY SERIOUS. Turns to his wife:

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Honey, I’ve gotta go back to work. (back to Roy) Why don’t you take a ride with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY, SAMIR MALIK in a SPEEDING MONORAIL. A LIT MAP IS IN FRONT OF THEM. With Malik is his right-hand, a woman name KATHRYN COLLINS. COLONEL LIPSET is with them, SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spot is in the middle of our complex of fission reactors. It’s a Westinghouse design, built--I wanna say six earth years ago? He looks to Collins:

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN COLLINS
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Right. Well, there was a meltdown in reactor three a few months after completion. Likely a result of industrial sabotage.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: What’s its current status?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Kathryn knows more than I do here. Roy TURNS TO THE MAP IN FRONT OF THEM as it scrolls northern hemisphere, then stops. Like Google Maps’ View”--a remote camera has captured the exterior of REACTOR. Roy studies the location. Collins points to the map, which shows a “skeleton” reactor’s innards. KATHRYN COLLINS (CONT’D) This area was walled-off after the disaster. They poured concrete to prevent further contamination. And many of the tunnels are still filled with cooling water. 64. up to the “Street a Martian of the Roy is studying images of a large TELESCOPE ARRAY near th reactor in Valles Marineris.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: What is that, to the right?

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN COLLINS
dialogues.text: A radio telescope. Still active. Which is why we're continuing to pump electricity, water, and oxygen through the reactor. No one’1ll spend the money to build a new telescope away from the contaminated area, and it needs those things to operate.  65.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: So this whole zone is deserted now-- but it still has power, that’s what I’m to understand?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: That is correct, major. Everyone falls silent. Lipset’s interjection is odd. Then

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN COLLINS
dialogues.text: SPACECOM'’s using Cornell University to do an ongoing study of the disaster. One of their fellows’s named Francesca DeSanctis. She’s their point person. As Roy sifts through the reactor scans:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I'd like to debrief her--if that’s okay with you.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: We'll get her to you. A TENSE BEAT. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Anything we should know here?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Doctor--how do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: (looks to Collins, then) Well...we had a power surge, couple of weeks ago, and we had a lot of repair work on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: I seem to recall reading that quakes happen here from time to time, maybe that was the cause.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: They do, but... (beat; shrugs) Look, we’ve heard rumors. About an explosion, off Neptune. (beat) I guess I’m wondering--should we...evacuate?  66. Colonel Lipset looks to Roy, who responds “properly”:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: The mission’s classified, I’m sorry. Malik purses his lips. Not the most encouraging answer. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Please find the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was once solely a chapel has been converted to a lab mixed with a weird version of a 1960's hippy ashram. Blankets, lamps, etc. A WOMAN whose back is to us.

dialogues.speaker: SAMIR MALIK
dialogues.text: Her name is Francesca DeSanctis-- she was born here. She’s part of the Cornell Extension program and had been working on the Mars geology project. So she’s been researching the territory for years. A CLOSE SHOT on FRANCESCA DESANCTIS, early forties, as sh turns around to us. Lovely but also fragile. Not physical delicate, but somehow, we can tell she's emotionally vulnerable. She is whiter than white--as if her skin has never seen sunlight. Veins are visible beneath her temple She looks into the camera, then STANDS UP, walks toward u ROY ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: (wide smile) Or morning.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (gentle smile in return) Right, yes. (beat) I’m from USSPACECOM, and I have some questions for you.  67.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I ask you not to be concerned, I just need to know what you know--

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I’m not concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s good... Dr. Malik informs me that you've been studying the reactors?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Yes. For about four years now, for a SPACECOM study. I toured the area myself before a series of quakes hit the area. I was the last to enter. (wry smile) I guess I’m the lucky one. (beat) All my records are on file, and I have adhered most strictly to all regulations. My scientific work is very important. It’s, it’s what I have.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (nods; then) You haven't noticed anything unusual inside the reactors?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Apart from the physical activity?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I informed SPACECOM about signs of a physical disturbance inside the reactor. Didn’t they tell you?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (thrown) No...I, I have no information on that matter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it’s my feeling that a person has been inside the core. I’ve noticed what I think are some very obvious signs. ROY IS STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can take you down there--if, if that’s where you need to go. I know the routes and I can help.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Thank you. I think I have enough information for now. I’11 contact you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Roy and Colonel Lipset are huddling. Lipset looks at DATA PAPERS. In medias res:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I do believe now it’s possible that my father escaped from Neptune, yes. Ina craft of some sort, perhaps--something of 3-D fabrication. We’d have to find out where he’s hiding here on Mars, course.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Either that, or it’s not him.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Sir, with respect, there’s no one else who had knowledge of the things that have been sent to me. It is him. Lipset looks up. A beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: No one’s been inside there for years. We don’t know what’s down there. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It could be extremely dangerous-- the radiation, the, the self- replicators may still be active. And you don’t know the way--

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I would go with Ms. DeSanctis. She would guide me to the location and I could then initiate the contact with my father. I would set her free and convince him to surrender. You'd have continued access to my data, and you could speak with me directly through my MMU. (beat) This is the necessary mission, sir. And time is critical. Lipset begins to BURN the DATA PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: We'll have to follow you close behind, ready to move and hopefully obtain intel on the Lima Project's precise location off Neptune. Roy LOOKS TROUBLED. DOES NOT SPEAK UP.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this a problem for you?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (beat) No sir...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Good. Because we’re only here to help. ANGLE ON ROY as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesca is getting a SPACESUIT put on her. She’s rarely had one on before; it looks awkward, almost preposterous, her. She’s older than Roy; she is lovely in her vulnerability. Incredibly aware and sensitive eyes--as we as a seemingly easygoing manner:  70.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Are you uncomfortable with the unit, Ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I’ve grown up with these but I’ve never liked them.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: This one’s considerably better than the earlier models. I’ve noticed increased flexibility with the newer MMUs. They have all our vitals here. And you can release all the nitrogen fuel at once, if you need to, from the pack or even from your boots, here. (beat; senses her stress) If you breathe normally, there’s no cause for panic.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: That’s what I try to do. (smiles) “Breathe,” I tell myself. It should be easy. It probably is, for you. She accepts that. Roy REACHES for a SMALL ELECTRONIC FLAT SCREEN, which he unfolds:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Is this map accurate?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: (nods; then) Yes. But when we get there, there’s also a guide rope that we installed through the tunnels right after meltdown. It leads to the center of the core.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Okay... (beat) And--and thank you, Ma’am. You can rest assured that this is of great importance, what you're doing. For the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: (nods; then) I’ve only been to earth once, actually. As a child. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a tissue disorder because I was born here. They said I'd die if I tried going back, through the radiation belt. But they’re working on new medications. Unexpectedly, she stops speaking. Looks at Roy. Her EYES

dialogues.speaker: WELL UP
dialogues.text: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) I remember it very well--I remember, it was extremely beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Some parts, yes. (lets out a laugh) Other parts...not so much.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: (interior) I wish I could be there...I wish, more than anything else... (louder; eases) A lot of people here get lonely. And they break down. The mental hospital at Helios is always full of patients. (sotto; looks at the map) It’s why I always thought the reactor crew itself caused the meltdown. I think they just lost it... A beat. She seems to get an idea: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) Hey, I think I saw a news program on you, from a few years back. I just realized, I think I know you!

dialogues.speaker: ROY IS MOMENTARILY CONFUSED
dialogues.text: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) It was--it was about the Space Antenna!

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Oh yes, the gravitational wave antenna. It’s almost finished now. It’s going to be an excellent project. We’ll be able to hear any intelligent life, possibly even respond.  72.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Maybe I’1l be able to go to the Earth and see it someday...

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Yes, it will be completed soon. Our team was really working toward that. All of us, back home. It’s a very worthy endeavor-- communication with other potential lifeforms. DeSanctis looks at her suit. Then: ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) I think you’re ready. A BUTTON on Francesca’s SUIT is PUSHED and it COLLAPSES AROUND HER, SNUG. She looks uncomfortable--but ready. Roy SMILES at her; he’s comfortable. There’s even a level of sexual attraction, maybe. Maybe. Roy talks to his sleeve: ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Doctor, Colonel--I think we're good to go here. ANGLE ON ROY as he LOOKS UP. THROUGH GLASS, we SEE: SAMIR MALIK and COLONEL LIPSET looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maze-like installation. A ROVER about to depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ROVER are Roy and Francesca. With KATHRYN COLLINS driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground opens up and the rover emerges onto the striki bright Martian terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rover drives alongside one of Mars's monumental canyo VALLES MARINERIS. It's amazing.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonder to behold. ALL DIALOG IS RADIO FILTER:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: That is Valles Marineris, over to your right--it’s a thousand times bigger than the Grand Canyon on earth. And just about every other month an earthsick person throws himself off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesca DeSanctis gestures to a large structure that they’re about to pass.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: The area we’re entering was self- sufficient at one time, with a greenhouse and self-replicating units for maintenance and repair. (to Collins) You can take us right to that white circle, Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN COLLINS
dialogues.text: Will do. Collins pulls the rover over to the side of the road, nea WHITE STEEL CIRCLE TUBE in the dirt--about 10 feet in diameter. Roy leans forward. To Collins:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I have activated GPS so you can find us. When we’re done. It reports that we have twenty-six minutes until we need to be inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATHRYN COLLINS
dialogues.text: Roger that. We’ll be more than happy to come pick you up on our Mars Taxi service! (no answer from Roy, So) Good luck, both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rover’s doors open. Roy steps out. Roy and Francesca are left all alone as the Rover leaves behind a trail of dust.  74. It’s silent. The landscape is mostly barren--the greenhou the radio telescope, and a few other structures are in th distance. A purple DUST STORM materializes, gathers, grows, approac The atmosphere is obscured. Luckily, the atmosphere is so thin that these twisters ar harmless--they just leave a RED/VIOLET HUE over Roy’s and Francesca’s spacesuit and helmet. Francesca finds a HATCH, covered in dust and dirt. POINTS ROY. Roy bends down, shoves the dirt away and find a meta protuberance. After removing more dirt, he is ABLE TO LIF UP THE HATCH. DOWN THEY GO, INTO AN UNDERGROUND CHAMBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONCRETE SARCOPHAGUS. A WALL. With a CIRCULAR WHEEL, leading DOWNWARD. FRANCESCA GESTURES. ROY TURNS THE WHEEL. It opens, and they descend into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY ARE NOW SWIMMING in a TUNNEL of DARKNESS. Roy and Francesca have HELMET LIGHTS which illuminate a few feet front of them. They PULL THEMSELVES ALONG by the GUIDE ROPE. ROY’S SLEEVE BLINKS: “EXCESSIVE RADIATION”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are dark. Only a few feet in front of Roy is illuminated. THE TWO PULL THEMSELVES ALONG THE ROPE SLOWLY and CAREFUL INTO THE DARKNESS. But then we see the movement of particulate in the air. Something is causing dust to disperse in that DARK TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Something appears to be moving.  75. The breaths quicken. TERROR on her face. He looks down the pipeway; he can foc on nothing else... SOMETHING begins to appear in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I just received a text message, imploring us not to proceed. It says if we do we will be destroyed... SLOWLY BUT SURELY we begin to make it out... It is a creaturelike SELF-REPLICATING MACHINE. We've SEEN SOMETHING LIKE IT before; they were working on tether, in the beginning of our story. But this one is larger, somehow more unforgiving. Its HEAD is ONE HEADLIG the head looks like Odilon Redon’s portrait of the CYCLOP It charges at them in silence, through the dense water. I appears to be WELDING--it has TENDRILS, like a HYDRA, whi it uses to push itself down the TUNNEL. It gets CLOSER AND CLOSER!

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Please send it code, tell it that we'll proceed no further and it need not be concerned. She is typing into her sleeve. A TENDRIL REACHES OUT abou to GRAB FRANCESCA. AND THEN IT STOPS. STOPS PROCEEDING. Roy steps forward. Approaches the enormous hydra, which seems frozen and no longer threatening. AT INCREDIBLE SPEED, he withdraws his PULSE WEAPON, FIRES

dialogues.speaker: IT. DIRECT HIT
dialogues.text: It moves spasmodically for a moment after it is hit--almo as if in physical pain. ROY APPROACHES IT, CLOSE, FIRING THE PULSE WEAPON to the CENTER of the EYE of the HEAD... THE HYDRA JERKS SPASMODICALLY AGAIN. ROY then GRABS FRANCESCA’S ARM; REACHES OVER and PULLS on what LOOKS LIKE A RIPCORD of sorts from his MMU.  76. THE MMU on ROY’S BACK RELEASES ALL THE NITROGEN in the PA YANKING HER and ROY with TREMENDOUS SPEED PAST THE DESTRO HYDRA; they TUMBLE THROUGH THE WATER, BLOWING away from t HYDRA and toward relative safety. ROY finds the CABLE, and, holding onto FRANCESCA, he uses own MMU for power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO ENTER: Francesca leads him.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (to radio) Command, it appears we encountered a self-replicator of some kind, perhaps one meant to secure the structure.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND VOICE
dialogues.text: Copy that, Major. Is it still active?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Negative. It has been disabled.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND VOICE
dialogues.text: All right, proceed to the core. You have twelve minutes until you reach the time indicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two enter a long, BLUE-LIGHT TUNNEL. After a few step Roy stops. Something's wrong:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Major? Are you all right? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: My pulse is getting a little more rapid here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Mine is as well. We didn’t expect to encounter that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The unit was perhaps agitated by the recent quake--disoriented by having to operate alone.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: No...Ma’am--that’s, that’s not it. Situations of that nature don’t present difficulties for me. (checks his numbers) And this is indicating that my metabolic levels are increasing only now, as we approach the core. (beat; to himself) I, I have to address this...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Should we wait to enter? (beat) Perhaps you’re getting anxious about what you’1ll find there--

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (interrupts) No. We must enter the core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They MOVE THROUGH the corridor to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive chamber. Roy and Francesca come ACROSS THE ENORMOUS BASE of the REACTOR. A FLICKERING SERIES of FLUORESCENT LIGHTS illuminate HALF the ROOM. It looks alm lived-in, frozen in time. Like there should be half-drunk cups of coffee on the consoles. Francesca DeSanctis’s back is to ROY.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Is this it, Ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: All right. Ma’am, I have to inform you, I’ve got an operation I need to conduct shortly, and it’s classified. So...you’re not going to be able to remain here. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I’m sorry. She LIFTS THE HELMET OFF HER HEAD. We STARE FOR A BEAT at the BACK OF HER HEAD. Then: ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Ma’am? Did you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Did it--ever seem possible that you might find out something about yourself? Something that might-- change you?

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I don’t know exactly what you’re referring to. As I said, I have some objectives, and our conversation has to be terminated now. FRANCESCA REACHES OVER, HITS a LARGE KEY on a console. A RECTANGULAR MONITOR begins to PLAY IMAGES WE'VE SEEN, of boy and girl at THE CLOISTERS!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: It always felt like we were destined to meet again. Like it was fate. THIS TIME, we SEE the ENTIRE SET OF IMAGES. A LARGE FAMIL at THE CLOISTERS. THE YOUNG BOY is DRAWING for a somewhat older GIRL. A SMALL PICNIC, or PARTY... AND the GIRL MOVE to SIT ON... H. CLIFFORD McBRIDE'S LAP. The BOY HANDS A DRAWING TO THE GIRL. FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) It’s the only time I saw you, the only time I was on earth. But--I feel as though I know you so well. Your father photographed you a lot as a child. And I still look at the pictures and the videos all the time. So...I feel very connected to you. (beat) I wish you knew about me. ROY IS FLUSTERED. FOR THE FIRST TIME in our STORY, HE IS TRULY THROWN.  79. The RADIO begins to SOUND in ROY’S HEAD:

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND RADIO
dialogues.text: Major, we are registering her non- compliance. We are within ten meters, ready to engage. She TURNS TOWARD HIM and US, HOLDING a BLACK FOLDER in HE HANDS. She takes a step toward him. He reaches down, towa his PULSE WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Your father was so lonely in his travels. He had another life here, on Mars. Another family. She smiles to him, gently--a genuine though somehow melancholy smile. FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) He is my father, too. FRANCESCA DESANCTIS then PUSHES THE BLACK FOLDER toward R She FLIPS IT OPEN. IT IS THE DRAWING THAT THE BOY GAVE THE GIRL in the VIDEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY LOOKS AT THE DRAWING. It’s incontrovertible. HE REALIZES. It’s TRUE. FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) He wanted me to reach out to you. I was afraid you couldn’t be trusted at first. But then I lost touch with him and when I saw you, I knew it was the right thing to do. (beat) I called for you, Roy. The messages were from me. HE APPROACHES the SCREEN. NOW IT IS FOOTAGE OF ROY throug the YEARS, beyond the IMAGES we’ve seen. HIM AS A TODDLER AS A TEEN, AS A CADET. FRANCESCA is NOW BEHIND HIM AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND RADIO
dialogues.text: Major, we are ready to intercede.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: What...is it you want from me...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: He needs our help.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (for himself) Dr. McBride...abandoned me...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: Your father went to Neptune to try and save us. Now Francesca, emotional as well, her back to us again: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) The mission went too far from the Earth, and many in the crew went insane... (over her shoulder, to Roy) You’ve seen for yourself how hard it becomes when the Earth is no longer visible. When they attempted their sabotage, he did what he had to do to continue on. (eyes back down to the floor) He is a truly great man. He told me they found antimatter, that he wanted to make it all anew. But he’s gone silent now. All his findings have stopped being sent to Earth. I am concerned--I worry for him so much... (she turns to Roy) He needs our help. I can locate him. I will give that to you. Roy STARES AT HER for a MOMENT. Lost, almost as if he’s short circuited:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I have...my own...directives. She approaches him:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: We're his family. He had no way back, but maybe you will. (beat) Please. He needs our help! He cared about you, he did. HE LOVED YOU, all this time. I know he did--  81. HE IS SHAKING. A BEEPING BEGINS; it’s his VITALS, on his

dialogues.speaker: SLEEVE. THEY'RE OUT OF CONTROL
dialogues.text: She touches his arm with tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: ALL OF A SUDDEN
dialogues.text: The DUCTS SLIDE OPEN. STEPPING IN: TANNER and YOSHIDA, in their suits. POINTING WEAPONS RIGHT AT HER. The THREAT is clear. FRANCESCA is startled. To her:

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: Down! On your knees! Right now! Roy begins to approach Francesca. The others intervene. A CHAOS BUILDS. AS TANNER PULLS OUT a STRANGE CORD: ALAN TANNER (CONT’D) We'll handle the interrogation from this point forward, Major.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: She--she may well have information only I can access here!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: Major, you are currently under no condition to continue this interview.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCRIDE
dialogues.text: That’s incorrect. It’s imperative that you interrogate her with me present-—

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: Orders are now that you are to retrieve all relevant data and return to the Cepheus. There is a shuttle waiting for you. She’1l be processed appropriately. TANNER PULLS HER AWAY. SHE IS YANKED OUT OF THE SPACE, an as she IS, SHE STARES AT ROY as the two EXIT. Yoshida remains, with Roy. Roy MOVES to the CONSOLE, where his FAMILY HISTORY CONTIN

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: Major, we have to proceed now.  82. Roy does not move. LIKE A SHORT CIRCUIT. FRANKLIN YOSHIDA (CONT’D) Major. (beat) MAJOR. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: CEPHEUS.
dialogues.text: YOSHIDA DEPARTS. ROY MOVES TO THE CONSOLE and BEGINS TO

dialogues.speaker: REMOVE THE DATA CARD FROM THE BOARD, UNSCREWING THE CARDS
dialogues.text: THE IMAGES OF HIM DISAPPEAR FROM THE SCREEN as he TAKES A THE INTEL HE CAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY EMERGES, boards the automated, driverless GPS-guided ROVER THAT IS WAITING FOR HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ROY...in the silent elevator car as it lifts up, away from Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy ENTERS/FLOATS INTO the DECK, returning from the eleva Roy retreats inward at the sight of Colonel Lipset:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (distant) The tasks are completed. Everything from the core’s system's been obtained...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Roy. SPACECOM and I felt it necessary to contact your associates from your trip to Mars. Your behavior with them did cause concern. We have fully briefed them now.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Concern...?  83.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: You sent data into space. You also neglected to take your sedative capsule, and you protested the response to a standard mayday call.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (sotto) You know why I resisted now... A WARNING LIGHT GOES OFF on the console.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: I'd recommend a sedative for you, Major.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: NO. My metabolics will return to normal in just a moment. The environment on Mars was high- stress, and it was a standard reaction. I just need to do this-- Roy ATTACHES the DATA BOX to the Cepheus. DATA BEGINS TO FLOW from it into the craft’s computer. Yoshida tries to hand Roy a pill and a cup of water.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: Major--

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Major, take the sedative--

dialogues.speaker: IS MY TASK.
dialogues.text: Roy PUSHES THEM AWAY. Alan Tanner looks to Donald Scobee. Scobee moves to speak into the console as the Cepheus DECOUPLES FROM the elevator’s docking platform:

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: SpaceCom, we are ready to proceed. ANGLE ON ROY as he is turned inward. No eye contact with rest of the crew.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: Major, I’m going to have to insist.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (to Colonel Lipset) What--was the result of your interrogation of Ms. DeSanctis? The men have no reaction at first. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Did you gain any further information from her? Then, without a word, LIPSET REACHES OVER and PRESSES a BUTTON ON the CRAFT’S CONSOLE MONITOR. He types in something, and on comes a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA IMAGE: THE SURVEILLANCE IMAGE is of Francesca DeSanctis, seated, what looks like a small white room with a dropped ceiling fluorescent light. We hear some MURMURING, which is UNINTELLIGIBLE from her, and from the others who surround her. ROY WATCHES, IN TURMOIL. The MEN who surround her are our team: Lipset, Tanner, Scobee, Yoshida. They are at moments on, and offscreen, their backs to us. They appear to be interrogating her. W HEAR SNIPPETS. “What were you doing there...?" “You are sitting there, without any..." She isn’t looking at them. Entering the FRAME is LIPSET:

dialogues.speaker: LOOK AT US.
dialogues.text: After a BEAT:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I won’t speak to you until Major McBride is here. He needs to be present.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Major McBride is not part of this particular operation. So you're going to need to respond to us-- right now, Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. I am not your enemy. You’re talking to me like I’m your enemy--and I am not.  85.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: You are admitting that Clifford McBride is your father, and you've been in contact with him. That’s correct, is it not? She stares at Lipset.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're aware he is posing a potentially catastrophic threat?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I need to see my brother. Major McBride.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS
dialogues.text: I need to see my brother. She STANDS UP. TANNER MOVES BEHIND HER with INCREDIBLE SPEED. As this is happening-- LIPSET THROWS her BACK, to the CHAIR. VIOLENTLY. But she still TRIES TO GET UP, so LIPSET SLAPS HER, HARD, ACROSS FACE. She FLAILS. The MEN CHARGE AT HER, and TANNER PUTS her in CHOKEHOLD. Francesca starts to GASP. And SHAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANCESCA DESANCTIS (CONT’D) I--I need help--

dialogues.speaker: DONALD SCOBEE
dialogues.text: If you want help, you’1l tell us-- Francesca SHAKES VIOLENTLY NOW. Is it a SEIZURE...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold on there--whoa-- SHE CRUMPLES TO THE GROUND, her body VIBRATING with uncontrollable force. WEIRDLY QUIET, FAST... TANNER PUTS HIS KNEE ON HER BACK. We HEAR the men through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the men are now ominously surrounding Roy. Tanner a the controls, initiating STAGE-1 liftoff away from the do

dialogues.speaker: ALAN TANNER
dialogues.text: .+-Booster looking good at 4 minutes. Level sense arm at 8 plus 17; outboard cut-off at 9 plus ll...

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (disturbed) Where--where is she?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: The subject is dead. She stopped breathing and couldn’t be revived. But we extracted the coordinates of the Lima Project transmissions. From the Mars reactor data. We know where to go.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (interior) You...killed her?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: It was likely some kind of congenital disorder. ROY’S RAGE is building.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Major, your contribution to this mission has come to a close. The ship’s STAGE-1 thrusters (minor, low-velocity) are FIRING, powering the ship away from the Helios’s upper station (the top of the space elevator).

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (reverts to form) What’s--what’s important here is...the mission.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: We're appreciative of your contributions.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I_have followed orders and accomplished my objective. I need to brief SpaceCom.  87.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN YOSHIDA
dialogues.text: SpaceCom’s already fully aware of the situation. You failed your last two psych-evals. Roy stops himself. He sees them surrounding him. Scobee i in front of a control panel. The Cepheus has reached a safe radius, about a mile away. So the STAGE-2, high-power rocket thrusters now have room fire safely. Tanner initiates Stage-2 procedure, a COUNTD begins. The suspense intensifies, and it’s eerie, as everyone’s j floating, suspended, waiting... Roy's FACE GOES WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL LIPSET
dialogues.text: Major. We don't want to have to eliminate you. Yoshida moves towards Roy. Yoshida continues forward, towards Roy--Roy’s eyes burn w intensity. Tanner GRASPS his PULSE WEAPON. It's clear they do want him DEAD. Scobee APPROACHES Roy, too. Lipset stays back. Just as Scobee is near Roy-- Roy IGNITES his MMU's BOOT JETS, which blow Scobee back against the opposite wall with such force that Scobee’s KILLED instantly, and he CRUSHES AND KILLS Lipset--behind -as well by the force of his body. The OTHERS MOVE TO ROY, who--PULLS DOWN on a THRUSTER on CONSOLE of the CRAFT. The ENTIRE CRAFT BEGINS TO REVOLVE, MAKING A FULL REVOLUT every SECOND. The CENTRIFUGAL FORCE PUSHES EVERYTHING to the SIDES of t craft--all the CLIPBOARDS, FLIGHT PLANS, PENS, PROCEDURE BOARDS, etc. STICK TO THE WALLS. The MEN are all SHAKEN up. Completely DISORIENTED for a moment. Tanner is shaken loose and hit hard, but he’s only stunne By this point, Yoshida ATTACKS Roy with vicious BLOWS. Roy LURCHES TOWARD the WALL of the CAPSULE; HE PULLS a sm metal CANNISTER that is strapped to the wall near him.  88. He swings the cannister at Yoshida and connects with Yoshida’s skull. Yoshida tumbles away. Now, it's just Roy and Tanner. Roy is bleeding. Tanner is holding a PULSE WEAPON. All Roy has is the cannister. But with the CRAFT SPINNING, it’s virtually impossible to AIM Tanner pulls the trigger--the weapon BLASTS. Roy manages to twist out of the way of what was bad aim d to the spinning. The BLAST barely misses him. ROY GRABS a PEN from the SIDE OF THE CRAFT. He STABS YOSHIDA in the NECK. YOSHIDA’S BLOOD BLOOMS. Thi FORMS GLOBULES of BLOOD in the WEIGHTLESSNESS! Roy uses the moment to EVADE Tanner. Utilizing the NETTING/WIRING along the side of the ship, Roy scrambles away. The SUNLIGHT COMES THROUGH the WINDOWS FLASHES AS FAST AS STROBE LIGHT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy moves around a CORNER, disappearing into a DARKER are the ship... INT. THE CEPHEUS - COCKPIT -— Tanner PULLS the REENTRY LEVER over his head. The CRAFT STOPS SPINNING. HE wraps YOSHIDA’S WOUND with a TOWEL, to stop the blood. He TURNS BACK AROUND to FOLLOW/KILL ROY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner pursues Roy. Tanner presses a BUTTON to OPEN the fairing door, and lea into that section, when... Suddenly, Roy emerges from the tangle of WIRES AND OTHER MATERIAL against the wall where he’d been hiding, and SHO Tanner deep into the fairing section. And Roy presses the button to CLOSE the fairing section door. He’s trapped Tanner in this part of the ship.  89. The Stage-2 COUNTDOWN approaches liftoff, and Roy hurries the safety of a harness just in time. He holds onto the harness as the Cepheus EXPLODES FORWARD. As the STAGING occurs, and the INTER-STAGE FAIRING SECTIO and ROCKET ENGINE beneath it can be seen through the wind below Roy, falling away into the void. NOTE: The physical environment in the ship is now especia CHAOTIC and MESSY: Wiring, equipment, debris, balls of bl and sweat... all criss-crossing this way and that in the g.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy moves into the cockpit. He check’s Yoshida’s pulse. Nothing. Yoshida is now DEAD. Roy eyes the floating CORPSES of former crewmates Scobee Yoshida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy prepares the two bodies with none of the ceremony or religion that were afforded to Blunt. He leaves them in t airlock and steps out, back into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses a button to open the airlock to the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SHIP RELEASES THE TWO BODIES as the Cepheus speeds away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy grabs a fresh helmet and moves into the cockpit. A ma ALONE. He PAUSES FOR A MOMENT; his HANDS are BLOTCHY and BLEEDING...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Significant damage to rocket staging capability... Reentry protection in section THREE DESTROYED...  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spaceship is moving at such a terrific velocity that there’s PERCEPTIBLE MOVEMENT in the surrounding field of stars: APPROACHING STARS appear blue, RECEDING STARS beco amber. (This is the “red shift” effect.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy is seated at the fore of the ship. He’s still BLEEDIN PROFUSELY. He goes through a MEDICAL KIT, applies GELS to his wound. He’s trying to stem the seeping tide of blood. He is ghostly and alone in the ship’s DARKNESS. And outsi of the ship’s darkness: INFINITE PITCH BLACK. But... finally... a slight GLOW appears from the COCKPIT MONITOR...

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Destination, Neptune Moon Galatea coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Length of journey: 19 days, 4 hours, 8 minutes. Sedation is advised. Roy HOOKS HIMSELF UP to a FEED TUBE, into his arm. He BUCKLES HIMSELF IN, and straps start sending ELECTRICAL PULSES to his body, to keep his muscles in some sort of t Roy SETTLES IN, and the ROCKETS ALIGHT... He is on his way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craft PASSES an UNMANNED SPACE PROBE... A distant ASTEROID FIELD... JUPITER, distant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy examines the view outside his window. He grows AGITAT ALL OF A SUDDEN, BLOOD STARTS POURING INTO THE CRAFT, fro

dialogues.speaker: EVERY WALL
dialogues.text: It FILLS THE CAPSULE!  91. YOSHIDA and SCOBEE are BACK, INSIDE. They ARE ASSAULTING

dialogues.speaker: WHAT IS HAPPENING
dialogues.text: And then-- THROUGH THE SPINNING--he REACHES over to the console and injects something into his arm. Within moments, the craft is no longer spinning. THE ASTRONAUTS ARE GONE. HE WAS HALLUCINATING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant gas planet SATURN looms magnificently against t black backdrop. Its RINGS look like thin ribbons encircli the planet. So perfect is this gas giant, so symmetrical flawless in its geometry... it almost looks UNREAL. We TILT DOWN to SEE the Cepheus PASS US BY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy’s EYES ARE HALF-MAST. His P.O.V.: A WATERY surface ov his eyes causes a slight oblong, double-vision VIEW of th CAPSULE CONSOLE.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Now passing final unmanned outpost, Trojan QF99. Conserve oxygen and food supply if possible-- ROY CLOSES HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet, in the distance. Roy’s spacecraft passes it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS. It’s a 1930’s RADIO SHOW that somehow his craft h picked up. ROY’S EYES OPEN. A STRANGE and NATURAL and UNEXPLAINED SPACE PHENOMENON OCCURS. What looks like FIREFLIES FLOWS through the CAPSULE. It’s HALLUCINATORY and ROY SEES THEM through SEDATED EYES. He REACHES UP to TOUCH THEM; the SPARKS SEEM TO FLOAT RIG THROUGH his HANDS. (These unexplained phenomena do exist. His BODY BEGINS TO LIFT UP, OUT OF THE SEAT. He STAYS in PLACE because of the seatbelts. His BREATHING BECOMES HEAVIER. Close to some kind of pani Roy starts to HYPERVENTILATE, STRUGGLING. He INJECTS something into his arm. As we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLUE PLANET. STILL. EERIE.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Task Load Index completed. ROY UNBUCKLES HIMSELF. MOVES back to the PILOT’S SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now: Roy’s spaceship, the Cepheus, comes into view, its R THRUSTERS firing on full blast (in utter silence) to slow velocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More prominently now, THE RINGS OF NEPTUNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of the OUTER RINGS. The Cepheus is tiny against th magnificent vista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy PILOTS the CRAFT as it nears the EDGE of the rings, a keeps pace with the speed of the rings’ orbit. Roy LOOKS DOWN at the CONSOLE. BLINKING: “CRAFT OXYGEN LEVEL: 12 PERCENT” He LOOKS OUT HIS WINDOW and is momentarily energized by Neptune’s BLUE GLOW. The rings are more visible now. They are magnificent, comprised of various-sized ROCKS of dirt ice that circle around us, almost like cars on a racetrac Roy looks at the control panels, the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Locate signal source.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: The source is [scientifically correct location, tbd]. He PULLS a LARGE SWITCH. The cockpit board flashes: “AUTOPILOT ENGAGED”. ROY PUNCHES THE GALATEA COORDINATES into his SPACESUIT SLEEVE. A BLINKING RED LIGHT on the CONSOLE. He REACHES OVER, TOGGLES THE SWITCH: EXT. THE CEPHEUS —- CONTINUOUS Roy EMERGES from the craft, in his suit. He REMAINS TETHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TO THE CRAFT. The CRAFT, moving along with the orbiting rings of detritus, begins to move closer to the rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He maneuvers his way BEHIND THE COCKPIT SECTION of the cr so he is protected FROM the DETRITUS of NEPTUNE’S RINGS b the CRAFT’S BODY ITSELF. He REMOVES a SMALL SOLAR PANEL--ABOUT FIVE FEET IN LENGTH and about THREE FEET IN WIDTH--from the SIDE OF THE CEPHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CLIMBS to the ROTATING ARTIFICIAL GRAVITY WHEEL. He GRABS ONTO ONE OF THE SPINNING WINDMILL-LIKE BLADES. HE UNHOOKS HIS TETHER. HE HOLDS ON. SPINNING AND SPINNING. DIZZYING.

dialogues.speaker: HE LOOKS AT HIS SLEEVE. A COMPASS NUMBER KEEPS SCANNING
dialogues.text: different DIRECTIONAL COORDINATES. AND THEN--at JUST THE RIGHT MOMENT-~

dialogues.speaker: HE LETS GO.
dialogues.text: HE IS PROPELLED THROUGH SPACE, without his TETHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the rings. Miniscule particles begin to hit the SOLAR PANEL that ROY USES AS HIS SHIELD. Some come insanely close to ROY, to his HEAD, to puncturi his SUIT. The SOLAR PANEL is GETTING NICKED and DAMAGED by the PARTICULATE, but it protects Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He TUMBLES FURTHER, now ENTERING THE CLOUDS OF NEPTUNE. The CLOUDS are DENSE, like bad CLOUD COVER during an airp flight. EXCEPT--THEY ARE A RICH, INTENSE BLUE. As Roy TUMBLES, the SHADE OF THE CLOUDS goes from that BL to a BEAUTIFUL and BEYOND-THIS-EARTH PINK, then to a DEEP MAGENTA. AND THEN IT BEGINS TO APPEAR, EVER SO FAINTLY. A SPACECRAFT. It is TETHERED to the slowly ROTATING MOON CALLED GALATEA which orbits NEPTUNE inside Neptune’s atmosphere. It is THE LIMA PROJECT. CLOSER AND CLOSER it comes to us. ROY SEEMS SPINNING TOWA IT, OUT OF CONTROL.  95. And then he THROWS the THRUSTER in his PACK. His tumbling GRADUALLY GETS UNDER CONTROL. He STOPS. OUTSIDE THE LIMA PROJECT STATION. IN the DISTANCE: a SYMMETRICAL SERIES of SCANNING MIRROR TELESCO In a LATTICE. NEW ANGLE OF ROY - behind him, in the deep distance, is Earth, a tiny pinprick of light 900 million miles away. ( recent Cassini photograph.) Then, CUT TO WHAT HE SEES: Hovering over the station, still far away from Roy, are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASTRONAUTS. Appearing as figures on the dark blue horizon levitating over NEPTUNE. THE LINE OF ASTRONAUTS FLOATS, STILL. ROY PUSHES a BUTTON on his WRIST. We HEAR STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: LIMA PROJECT. This is Major Roy McBride. I have taken control of the Cepheus, United States Armed Forces Space Division. I am attempting to reach Dr. Clifford McBride. Over. Static. No movement. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Repeat: Lima Project, this is the Cepheus, of the United States Armed Forces Space Division. I am attempting to reach Dr. McBride. Do you read. NO RESPONSE. ROY TURNS his RIGHT WRIST OVER. “MMU OXYGEN LEVEL: 21 PERCENT” “THRUST LEVEL: 39 PERCENT” HE MOVES toward the SURFACE of the LIMA PROJECT STATION. HE DOES, he LOOKS to his RIGHT to SEE, maybe a mile away (hard to tell relative direction here), the very BEGINNIN of a graphene arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy “floats” inside. The Craft/Station has a kind of LARG FRAME. Roy VENTURES through the CENTER of the STATION. HUGE SPACES filled with SELF-REPLICATORS that do not rese anything anthropormorphic, but rather look like the kind machines which make AUTOMOBILES. WE HEAR Roy’s BREATHING. ROY’S P.O.V. - The robots are in repose, ready to be awakened. WE CONTINUE TO HEAR Roy’s BREATHING... He passes the anthropoid robots, and enters another, even larger, area. ROY’S P.O.V. - A flurry of automated activity, as we pass EVERY SPECIES OF ROBOT, from giant vehicles to small, squ machines, gliding to and fro. Some are fitted with grabs manipulators and cutting/welding equipment. Again, no sign of humans. The robots move slowly, with secret purpose, WARNING LIGHTS whirling for the benefit o the unseen humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY now ventures to SEE, on both sides: WINDOWS, through which we can spot the INTERIOR of the LI PROJECT. As Roy makes some final adjustments to his equipment, we notice one of the very small robots on the side of the A- Frame. A CAMERA mounted on it silently ROTATES towards Ro and a RED LIGHT blinks on next to the camera. It knows Ro is here. Roy LOOKS RIGHT INTO IT:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I am Major Roy McBride. Do you read. I am attempting to reach Dr. McBride. AGAIN, no ANSWER. ROY PLACES EXPLOSIVE CHARGES on the DOORFRAME of the LIMA STATION. They BLOW. Just then, an APERTURE on the station opens up. ROY VENTU INSIDE. LIKE HE IS ENTERING A DREAM.  97. INT. LIMA PROJECT —- DORMITORIES HUMAN BODIES are FLOATING, gravity-free. The FLUORESCENT LIGHTS FLICKER. We STILL HEAR ONLY ROY’S BREATHING. LOUD, PRESENT. We ARE COMPLETELY INSIDE HIS HEAD. Roy finds himself inside a KITCHEN-TYPE area, which is ho somewhere within a laboratory. There are machines and equipment and tables and sinks, but no people besides Roy There’s ZERO GRAVITY here.

dialogues.speaker: ROY'S POINT-OF-VIEW
dialogues.text: A DOOR IS OPEN, revealing a dark PASSAGEWAY lit only by B LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy enters/floats into it. ALL OF A SUDDEN, ALL THE MONIT on each side--and there are several--switch on. THE LIGHT BRIGHTEN. ON THE SCREENS: ROY’S FATHER! DR. H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE. Roy HALTS:

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: This will be the final message recorded by the Lima Project. Our efforts have come to an end, and its entire story must be told in the hopes that someday it will be known. ROY MOVES CLOSER TO THE SCREEN. It is his FATHER, virtual seeming to speak from the dead: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) We came here to pursue mankind’s most noble goal: the search for intelligent life beyond the Earth. But our telescope has repeatedly confirmed only the singular importance--and ephemerality--of our moon, oceans, and magnetic field. After extensive analysis, we now confirm that we are entirely alone in the reachable universe. We shall no longer honor false gods; there is no intelligent life elsewhere, and the rage of the cosmos will destroy us in time. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) For this reason, we on the Lima Project had begun to devise a plan for a new system--with galaxies, stars, and planets. We dreamed to be the first lifeform to make the universe anew. CLOSE ANGLE ON ROY MCBRIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy CLIMBS the STEPS. We STILL HEAR, CONTINUING:

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE, (V.O)
dialogues.text: With the vast stores of antimatter we have discovered here, our research focused on the creation of a new big bang. Such a project would take perhaps several thousand years to develop. But only such a bold, long-term endeavor would untether us from the earth and ensure the permanent survival of our species.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Roy FLOATS TOWARD the Control Center. Like the Control To of a large airport, it’s somewhat dark--but everything is Multiple MONITORS, SCREENS, GAUGES, etc., all like a symp of blinking, fluttering color and light.

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Our research is contained on the onboard VD recorder. It is the most extensive set of data ever assembled about the visible universe. This must be brought back to Earth so that our scientists can be convinced to act. However, our computer system is currently preventing all outside communication. As it is charged only with the continued pursuit of intelligent life, it has been unable to adapt to our changed prerogatives. All attempts to reprogram it have failed. With no alternatives, we sought to return to the Earth.  99. Roy looks around at the many screens in front of him; the are like SECURITY CAMERAS, constantly cutting from one an to another. ONE ANGLE REVEALS: A SPACECRAFT, with a GANTRY. MODEST SIZE. CLOSE SHOT ON

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE OF SPACECRAFT. THEN
dialogues.text: ROY SCANS THROUGH BASIC BLUEPRINT PLANS of the LIMA PROJE CRAFT. INT. DATABANKS —- LIMA PROJECT It is ROWS of DATA, stored. A CLOUD for all the informati collected by the Project. Roy FLOATS THROUGH IT, approaching TWO LARGE ORANGE STEEL CANNISTERS: “VOYAGE DATA RECORDER” He PULLS THEM OUT FROM THE FRAME. Over this, we STILL HEAR: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) A craft was assembled from 3-D- printed parts, piece by piece, out of view of the onboard system. But it was recognized upon completion, and our nuclear fuel has been intentionally destroyed by the system. This resulted in the catastrophic destruction of moon Larissa. All of us have suffered severe radiation poisoning. Brain death is imminent. The onboard system will likely maintain only our organ function in order for it to remain operational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT: “DR. CLIFF MCBRIDE”. A PAPER TAB, HANDWRITTEN On the DOOR of his LIVING QUARTERS. Roy FLOATS INTO/ENTERS the LIVING QUARTERS.

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We hope we will be mourned by a Mother Earth that dared send so many of her sons and daughters into the unknown. In ancient days, human beings looked at stars and saw their heroes in the constellations. In modern times, our heroes have become creatures of flesh and blood. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Others will follow us, and surely find their way home. Our mission must not be denied. HE LOOKS AROUND. He SEES the SPACE. It is MODEST, with SCIENCE BOOKS, and DIARIES, and FAMILY PHOTOS everywhere, pinned on the WALLS. Then we HEAR Francesca’s VOICE, more PRESENT than CLIFFORD McBRIDE’S had been: FRANCESCA’S VOICE “The brain is wider than the sky, for, put them side by side, the other will include, with ease, and you beside...” (beat) It’s so beautiful... Do you want to hear another one...? Then, APPEARING: FRANCESCA! SEATED, SOMEHOW STILL OBEYING GRAVITY as ROY FLOATS! She STARES, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy doesn’t know what to do, or say. He STOPS HIS MOVEMEN He lifts his ARM toward her... She GETS UP, begins to WALK TOWARD ROY! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEAR HIM NOW, HE REACHES OUT, and...

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND AND ARM GO RIGHT THROUGH HER
dialogues.text: THROUGH HIM, sits down at the other end. Roy LOOKS AROUND THE SPACE and SEES NOW that it’s like hi home where he grew up, his home from pictures. PROJECTED. IT’S ALL HOLOGRAMS. He SEES: HIMSELF, as a CHILD, on the FLOOR, PLAYING WITH TRUCKS. And his MOTHER, LEANNE, YOUNGER. His HAND can go right through them, too. (As ROY FLOATS, these HOLOGRAMS remain “earthbound”; that they seem to have “gravity”.) Roy TURNS BACK to LOOK AT FRANCESCA. She is in conversati with someone “offscreen,” smiling, looking lovely and war and everything an idealized version of her would be. CLOSE ANGLE ON ROY. We HEAR the PITTER-PATTER of RAIN. RAIN? ALL OTHER SOUND DROPS OUT. And we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lowered gray sky. Deserted. A monastery on the UPPER WE SIDE of NEW YORK’S MANHATTAN ISLAND. A PORTCULLIS. COBBLESTONES. The VIDEO we saw, yes, but now we are “here in the space. A GROUP of children PLAY. ADULTS speak to each other, standing behind the children, watching them play, making small talk. The scene has a strange, dare we say, unearth quality to it. There is a distance to it; not an emotiona distance, but a visual distance. A haze, almost. A dreamlike quality. A SMALLER GROUP of adults, and two children, are here, to They are nearby and yet somehow apart. We SEE: ROY’S MOTHER, LEANNE. Much YOUNGER. She seems PREOCCUPIED, though she smiles a lot as she attends to th children. Also here is some other woman we don’t know, ab Leanne's age. She is completely quiet, almost nervous, as she watches the children play. Then there is H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE, who is involved with t children, making hats for them, drawing for them, joking them. AMONG THE CHILDREN: the young ROY. And the young FRANCESC (though she is older than Roy--she seems around 16 or 17, around 8). She has a grin from ear to ear; Roy does not, instead dedicated to whatever he seems to be DRAWING. H. Clifford McBride stops clowning with another child and moves to Roy’s side. Warmly:

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Roy? (beat) Roy? (to Young Francesca) He gets very involved in what he’s doing.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: (a laugh; a smile) It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, I need you to listen to me for just a moment--you can go back to your drawing very soon. Roy finally looks up--for just a brief beat.  102. H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) This is Francesca.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: (ebullient) Hello!

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (back to his drawing) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: She’s someone...very close to me, someone I really care for. I want you to meet her--I think you'll really like her. Roy keeps drawing--AND THEN TURNS HIS BACK TO HER A BIT. H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) It’s not so easy for Roy to meet new people. It’s something we’re trying to work on with him. (quieter) We’re hoping he’1ll break through it someday... Clifford approaches Roy. Not unsympathetically, he touche his son and attempts to communicate an important lesson a human interaction: H. CLIFFORD MCBRIDE (CONT’D) (to Roy) When someone talks to you, you say hello, you look them in the eye. You listen, and you ask how they are--you don’t want them to think you don’t care about them. Roy REACTS IMMEDIATELY. He starts to get teary out of embarrassment and awkwardness. Sensing this, she moves to comfort him:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: It’s okay, you can go back to your drawing. He just wanted us to meet. Roy then eyes her directly, and without a word. She looks his drawing. Warmly: YOUNG FRANCESCA (CONT’D) That's a wonderful picture. Is that a rocket?  103.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (nods; then) My father goes into space.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: That’s where I’m from.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: (looks up, interested now) Where?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: I’m from Mars. Which is really, really far.

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sometimes it’s more than 140 million miles away. But right now it’s only 80 million miles.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: (again with a laugh) I didn’t know that!

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: Are you by yourself there?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: No, but it feels like that sometimes. That’s why I’m so glad I met you. UNEXPECTEDLY, responding to her kindness to such a degree can overcome his shyness, he hands his drawing to her. Francesca looks at the drawing and she is very moved. TEA OF HAPPINESS come to her eyes. Roy STARES at the tears as though they are foreign objects. The SWELL OF EMOTION fro her is as strange as anything he has seen. YOUNG FRANCESCA (CONT’D) Oh--thank you so much! That’s so sweet of you! It’s beautiful! She gives him a BIG, TENDER HUG. Roy ALLOWS HIMSELF to be “crushed” by the hug. Roy's FATHER BEAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chamber that appears almost like an old “Iron Lung” machine. Roy APPROACHES IT. CLOSE SHOT: “MCBRIDE, CLIFFORD, 788919-0323” It’s a small, illuminated medical identification card. WI

dialogues.speaker: TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: ROY, COMING UPON his FATHER’S BODY, inside what looks lik kind of ELECTRONIC SARCOPHAGUS. Dr. H. Clifford McBride exists in a vegetative state, res in a large silver CASE. Through glass, we can SEE that hi EYES ARE slightly OPEN, his BODY HOOKED UP to LIFE SUPPOR SYSTEMS. MONITORS around the case MEASURE his PULSE and other VITA SIGNS. He is KEPT COLD. ROY moves to it, OPENS THE SARCOPHAGUS. STARES AT HIS FATHER’S LOBOTOMIZED FACE. He LIFTS his FATHER’S STIFF, LIFELESS BODY out of its electronic SARCOPHAGUS, pulling off the DIODES and IVs wh keep him “alive”. When the body EMERGES from the SARCOPHAGUS, it seems almo to FLOAT STANDING STIFFLY UPRIGHT. It starts SPINNING IN WEIGHTLESSNESS. ROY GRABS the SPINNING BODY, in a way that becomes an EMBRACE. PULLING THE BODY WITH HIM, he FLOATS BACK OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY releases his FATHER’S BODY INTO SPACE, PUSHING IT TOW the SURFACE of NEPTUNE. IN the DISTANCE, WE SEE H. CLIFFORD McBRIDE’S BODY drift TOWARD a RING AROUND NEPTUNE. The BODY comes in contact with a SMALL ICE ROCK. It SHATT INTO A MILLION PIECES. LIKE BROKEN WINDSHIELD GLASS. Almost at the VERY INSTANT that H. CLIFFORD McBRIDE’s BOD destroyed, LIGHTS COME ON in a formerly DARKENED SECTION the LIMA CRAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacecraft which remains DOCKED. It has been constructe for Dr. Clifford McBride’s return, presumably. It NOW HUM WITH LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy enters the cockpit, HOLDING the ORANGE VDR ("VOYAGE D RECORDER”) CANNISTERS. Examining the craft’s SYSTEMS, he and we recognize that i astonishingly similar to the Cepheus. (The spacecraft are all constructed by 3-D PRINTER, and there is a uniformity their design and construction.) The entire SYSTEM of the CRAFT COMES TO LIFE, ONLINE. AS DOES: RADIO STATIC FROM THE EARTH! Communication has b restored:

dialogues.speaker: ROY MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: SpaceCom. This is Major Roy McBride. I have taken it upon myself and have reached the Lima Project; all crew are deceased. I have recovered significant material for analysis, which I am now in the process of forwarding to you. The self-replicators here malfunctioned and must be destroyed to prevent any unforseen further catastrophe. Therefore, I’m inputting target coordinates 34.34 North, 81.92 West from Earth standard vector 100. (beat) I’m going to attempt a return to the earth now. The onboard system indicates I’1l be arriving in approximately 41 days and 9 hours. My journey will have kept me in an isolated state for a considerable period by that time. I...I am very much looking forward to the day that solitude ends. Over. He FLIPS OFF THE RADIO. He PULLS DOWN on a LARGE LEVER which looks almost like th kind of control switch for a 747 airplane.  106. He moves around the CAPSULE, OBSERVING a PRINTED CHECKLIS Adjusts SEVERAL SWITCHES.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Roy is SETTLING IN to his COCKPIT SEAT. He is about to PU an OXYGEN MASK ON. He activates the CRAFT’s GYROSCOPES an CONTROL STICK. Then: ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Outgoing mail. McBride, Roy M. Send to Leanne McBride. He SEES an IMAGE of HIS MOTHER. It’s a photo of her, with him as a little boy. A little ANIMATED BEE flies around t picture, making a PUTT-PUTT SOUND. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Record voice message. After a BEEP--Roy begins to record his message. As we kno he’s not much one for communicating--especially when emot are concerned. But here... ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Mother, I’m on a classified mission right now. (beat) I am by myself. THE CAMERA SLOWLY--almost imperceptively so--PUSHES INTO ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) (equivocating; then he steels himself) I am attempting now to return to the earth. In the event I cannot, I don’t want you to wonder about me. (beat) I'd like to express to you that I realize that you gave me an excellent childhood. I am grateful to you now for attempting to nurture friendships and other relationships. Perhaps you don’t think I remember much, but I do. Sometimes the smell of certain foods will bring back exceedingly pleasant memories... On this mission I’ve encountered people who knew father. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops. HIS HEAD. 107. ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) I don’t know how much you know about this, but it appears he had another child, a daughter named Francesca. We both met her once. She and I talked. She informed me that father acted out of the noblest principles. And that he sacrificed himself in the name of science. TEARS WELL UP AGAIN. He CLOSES HIS EYES and BOWS Then begins to speak again: ROY MCBRIDE (CONT’D) Mother, I, I was unable to protect her. I regret this--terribly. Even worse than I regret any negative feelings toward father. It’s led me to commit acts that you would condemn--but were required by circumstance. It has forced me to be alone, a situation I now find unacceptable. (exhales; regroups) But I have succeeded in my mission. I want to say goodbye now, and whatever occurs on my return, I am forever your loving son. He SHUTS OFF the RECORDER. ANGLE ON THE FROZEN IMAGE of ROY’S MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Craft’s GANTRY RELEASES the ship. Slowly. The CRAFT begins to move, its ROCKETS FIRING. Almost at the same time: A BEAM, HIGH-INTENSITY, HITS A P

dialogues.speaker: OF THE STATION.
dialogues.text: It EXPLODES! In SILENCE. The colors of the explosion, set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: against the DEEP BLACKNESS of SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then another SILENT and COLORFUL EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy looks through his windows to SEE: A SERIES OF LASERS HITTING VARIOUS PARTS of the STATION a TELESCOPE.  108. In SILENCE, the EXPLOSIONS ARE VAST, FEROCIOUS, and someh oddly BEAUTIFUL. They ILLUMINATE the dead BLACKNESS of SPACE even as they utterly destructive, devastatingly so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy’s ROCKET starts to STAGE, AFTER its initial BURST. It leaves the CONTINUED DEVASTATION of the LIMA PROJECT in i wake as it PROPELS FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy’s HEAD SHAKES TO AND FRO; the ROCKET’S FORCE is ASTONISHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRAFT FIRES a NEW SET OF ROCKETS. It moves on, deeper and deeper and deeper toward the earth. The RADIO PIPES U and it’s in the most straightforward, almost banal, tone imaginable:

dialogues.speaker: SPACECOM VOICE
dialogues.text: Major McBride, this is SpaceCom. We have verified the authenticity of your coordinates and have begun to target sites accordingly. Upon reentry to earth’s orbit, we will intercept your craft and you will be debriefed. However, we do acknowledge the potential of your data files to transform rather radically our view of what the universe may hold. (beat) We wish you godspeed on your journey homeward. US SPACECOM out. Finally, Roy’s ROCKET disappears from our view, hurtling toward the EARTH. The End
